newsitem.title: USA: Equity Corp Q1 net increases.
newsitem.headline: Equity Corp Q1 net increases.

text.p: NOTE: The results for 1997 include funeral revenues and related costs of $1,674,000 and $924,000, respectively, related to the acquisition of a cemetery in exchange for one of the company's funeral homes.
The results for 1996 include $2,085,000 and $1,135,000, respectively, related to the buyout of several long term licensing and lease agreements.

The provision for income taxes in the first quarter of 1996 reflects a charge for the required change in the company's federal income tax rate from 34 percent to 35 percent of $565,000, to revalue deferred tax liabilities.
Earnings per share and average shares outstanding for the first quarter of 1997 reflect the company's 3-for-2 split effective October 1996.

Net income for the first quarter of 1997 reflects a pretax gain of $750,000, or approximately $0.02 per share after tax, as a result of selling one of the company's funeral homes in exchange for a cemetery and $250,000 cash.
Net income for the first quarter 1996 reflects a pretax gain of $950,000, or approximately $0.04 per share after tax, as a result of the buyout of several long-term licensing and lease agreements.
